lines.text:
[to Bannion]
Well, you're about as romantic as a pair of handcuffs.

[to Bannion]
I guess a scar isn't so bad. Not if it's only on one side... I can always go through life sideways.
They come and go like flies.
Only this fly got herself strangled.
These things, happen, Sergeant.

[to Bannion]
The main thing is to have the money. I've been rich and I've been poor. Believe me, rich is better.

[to Mrs. Duncan about their almost identical fur coats]
We're sisters under the mink.
Vince threw hot coffee in my face. I'm gonna' be scarred. The whole side of my face will be scarred.
[breaks down sobbing]
Hey, that's nice perfume!
Something new. It attracts mosquitoes and repels men.
It doesn't work that way with me.
It's not supposed to.
[She gives him a teasing kiss]
[Debby surveys Bannion's undistinguished hotel room]
Hey, I like this. Early nothing!
It was bad judgment to bother a cop's widow about the love life of her husband.
Good or bad, it was my judgment.
You're missing the point. I'm the one that gets the pressure calls from upstairs. I'm the one that has to explain. You don't keep an office like this very long stepping on a lot of corns.
You want me to go upstairs and explain?
Not you. You're a corn stepper by instinct.

[leaving Bannion's hotel room]
You really want me to go?
I wouldn't touch anything of Vince Stone's with a ten-foot pole.

[Has just thrown scalding coffee in Vince's face]
It'll burn for a long time, Vince. It doesn't look bad now. But in the morning your face will be like mine.

[Sticks her face up close to Vince's, then dramatically rips the bandages from her scarred face]
Look at it. It isn't pretty, is it? You'll walk through the side streets and alleys so that people won't stare at you. But you're lucky. It won't be for long.

[to Vince]
Prisons are bulging with dummies who wonder how they got there.

[to Larry Gordon]
I'm through with you - but your friends aren't. I'm going to spread the word that you talked. You're out of business, thief.

[having explained her blackmail-protection plot]
The coming years are going to be just fine.
There aren't going to be any coming years for you.

[to Bannion]
This is my home and I don't like dirt checkd into it.

[to Lagana]
You know, you ouldn't find enough flowers around here to kill the smell.
You have any doubts Duncan killed himself?
No, none at all, but I just got back from the county morgue.
You mean that barfly? I read the teletype about your identification.
Lucy Chapman used to be Duncan's girlfriend.
And the army's and navy's.

[to Stone about his quick retreat when Bannion threatened him]
You made better time than they make in the Olympics.
It doesn't matter to you that Slim might have been mixed up in a murder?
Sure it matters, but what can I do about it? I don't know anything.
You're a liar.
You can't insult me, mister. I said I don't know anything about it, and that's how it stands.
You know, I've been meetin' your kind every day for ten years... scared rabbits that never see anything. You wouldn't stick out your big, fat neck for anybody, would you?
That's the truth, but it's my big, fat neck. So now, if you're through talkin', I'll get back to work.
I ought to...
[Bannion makes a threatening move toward him]
That won't change my story. Cops get paid to take risks - I'm not. You see, I've got a wife and kids too.

[about Lucy Chapman]
Where'd she live?
If I ask for an address, they lie. It's not worth the bother. They're floaters. Not much more than a suitcase full of nothin' between them and the gutter.
Hey, you know somethin'? You ought to be doin' radio commercials - how to talk a lot and say nothin'.

[On the phone]
This is not a social call, Debby. Tell Vince I want him right away.
Oh, sure, Mr. Lagana, I always like to tell Vince you're calling. I like to see him jump.

[to Bannion]
When Vince talks business, I go out and get my legs waxed or something.

[to Bannion]
Your big trouble, Honey, is that you attack yourself from all sides like Jersey mosquitoes.
Do you mind if I walk around your yard? Talk to your men?
I have to mind. When it comes to my bread and butter, I stay careful.
It doesn't matter to you that Slim might have been mixed up in a murder, hmm?
Sure it matters. But what can I do about it? I don't know anything.
You're a liar.
You can't insult me, mister. I said I don't know anything, and that's how it stands.
You know, I've been meeting your kind every day now for ten years. Scared rabbits who never see a thing. You wouldn't stick out your big fat neck for anybody, would you?
That's the truth. But it's my big fat neck. So now if you're through talking, I'll get back to work.

[Approaches Mr. Atkins threateningly]
I oughta'...
That won't change my story. Cops are paid to take risks. I'm not. You see, I've got a wife and kids, too.
[Bannion glares at him and walks away]
